### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:John joined the army because he wanted to see the world.  When the fighting started, he only saw what sort of things? Choices:  A: fort B: orphans C: battlefield D: other countries E: war<n>Output:		B  <n><n>Input:John went to Chicago because he wanted to see a ______ of art.<n><n>The first set of choices is true.<n>Output: A: museum B: gallery C: theater D: concert<n><n>Input: John went to Chicago because he went to __________ of art.<n>The second set of choices is not true.<n>Output: C: theater<n><n>### My Solution<n>```<n>function numberOfLines(data) {<n>    let count = 0;<n>    for(let line of data){<n>        line = line.split("\n");<n>        count += line.length<n>    }<n>    return count;<n>}<n>function instruction(line) {<n>    const array = line.split(" ").filter(item => item == true);<n>    if (array[0] == "A" && array[1] == "true") return [numberOfLines(array[2])+ 3 ];<n>    else return  array[1];<n>}<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Sometimes it felt like being able to pay bills was the only reason he was actively what? Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n>Output:		C<n><n>### A. A and B<n>### B. B and E<n>### C. All of them.<n><n>### Instruction:Now, write the program and test it, write the output.<n><n>```java<n>import java.util.Scanner;<n><n>class Program{<n>    static void main(String[] args){<n>        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);<n>        <n>        System.out.println("Input: Janet has "+scan.nextLine()+" cards more than Brenda.\n"+<n>        "Mara has "+scan.nextDouble()+" cards more than Janet.\n"+<n>        "\nInput: "+scan.nextLine().trim()+" blocks.");<n>        <n>        /*Find the solution */<n>        double b = 0;<n>        if(scan.nextDouble() >= 45){<n>            b =  2*scan.nextDouble() - 40;<n>        }<n>        double result = 211;<n>        if(b > 0 && b < 5)<n>        {<n>            result = 0;<n>            System.out.println(211-b+" blocks");<n>        }<n>        while(true){<n>            b = 0;    <n>            if(scan.nextLine().contains("more than")){<n>                b = 4.5;<n>            }<n>            else if(scan.nextFloat() >= 4.5){<n>                b = 2.0*scan.nextFloat()-40.0;<n>            }<n>            <n>            else if(b < 0 || b >= 3){<n>                System.out.print("error, please enter again...");<n>            }<n>             else {<n>               result = 0;   <n>                }<n>        }<n>        if(b == 4.5){    <n>            scan.nextLine();<n>            <n>        }while(true);<n>        <n>    }<n>}<n><n>```
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. Choices:  A: jar B: stick to fingers C: beehive D: stick to fingers E: farmer's market<n>Output:		C: beehive<n><n>Input: 15 is 1/5 of what number?<n><n>Output:<n><n>Input:<n><n>Output: <n><n>Input:<n>\end{code}<n><n>\strong{Code}<n><n>\begin{code}<n>def get_one(cards=9):<n>    cards = []<n>    def get_ten(ten):<n>        if ten in cards:<n>            return cards<n>        else:<n>            return get_ten(ten+1)+get_ten(ten-1)<n>    cards[10]=get_ten(cards)<n>    return cards<n><n>get_one()<n><n>#solution -<n>def get_one():<n>    def divider(num, ten):<n>        while num > 10:<n>            if num == 10:<n>                return []<n>            num = num-1<n>            print num<n>            ten = ten-1<n>        num = num//10<n>        ten = ten-10<n>    num = 1<n>    ten = 10<n>    print (ten)<n>    return divider(num,ten)<n><n>if __name__=="__main__":<n>    get_one()<n>\end{code}{}<n><n>Answer: Try making a function for the questions and calling the function multiple times.<n><n>\begin{pre}<n>`questionQ[i] = input()`<n>\end{pre}<n><n>\begin {code}<n># Importing Functions from previous part<n>from previous import get_one<n><n># questionQ is an array to store questions<n>questionQ = []<n># function to store questionQ in an array<n>def q_Ans_array():<n>    array = []<n>    for i in questionQ[1:]:<n>        ans = input(questionQ[i])<n>        ans = get_one(ans)<n>        array.append(ans)<n>    return array<n>print(q_Ans_array())<n>\end{code}.<n><n>Comment: your solution is working only if the user types a single answer to the question, e.g., if in step 5 the user inputs `i am looking  to buy honey`, the answer is `[D]`.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Where is a note likely to indicate a melody? Choices:  A: fridge B: a classroom C: envelope D: medical chart E: sheet music<n>Output:		envelope<n><n>Input: There are 3 bikes under the umbrella. 2 of the bikes don't have pedals. How many bikes don't pedals has? Choices: A: 2 B: 1 C: 3 D: no answer<n><n>## 4.2 Solution:<n><n>```c++<n>/*<n> * Solution:<n> */<n>#include <bits/stdc++.h><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main() {<n>    int A, B, C;<n>   cin >> A >> B >> C;<n>    cout << (A + B * 2) / C << endl;<n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n><n># 4.3 Solution:<n><n>```<n>* Solution:<n>```<n>#include <bits//stdcxx//h><n>using namespace c;<n>int main() {int a, b; cin>>a>>b; cout<<a+b*199/15+b/a;return 0;}<n>```<n><n>```<n># 4.1 Solution:<n><n>```cpp<n>#include "stdlib.h"<n>using namespace std; <n>    <n>int main() { int input; cin>> input; int count; <n>    if(input == 20) { <n>        cout<<"envelope"<<endl; <n>        for (int i= 0; i<= 10; i++) { <n>            count = (count++) + 1; <n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>```<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices: A: 7-35 B: 35-7 C: -35-7 D: 35-07<n>Output: B<n><n>Input: You have a deck of Cards. You know the value assigned to the 4 suits: Spades is 13, Hearts is 4, Diamonds is 16, and Clubs is 15. How many different poker hands can you make using any number of cards from a single Deck?<n>Output: 78794456<n><n>Input: A person and a bicycle are both moving at 16 kmph,what will be the speed of the combination in kmph?<n>Output: 32<n><n>Input: How long does it take for the sun to revolve?Choices: A: 2315 years B: 365 days C: 1 year D: 26.5 days<n>Output: A<n><n>Input: How was the city of Houston established? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Bob and Boris were standing in a queue at the grocery store.  They were standing in place.  The line was fast, but the children in front of them were loud.   They were what? Choices:  A: frustration B: being annoyed C: delays D: irritation E: out of order<n>Output:		C,  Answer:  C,<n>Ans:  65 + 85 = 150 <n><n><n><n>### Solution<n>In java, I did the following.<n><n>The first method takes a single variable (cards) and prints the solution.<n><n>Input:  Janet has 9<n>Output: 150;<n><n>The second method takes 4 separate variables (Janet, Brenda, Mara, Janet). The variables come from the user. You must get the values from the user before the program starts running. I do this by first making an array of variables and then calling array.length() to get the length of the array.<n><n>The third method solves the question.<n><n>Inputs:<n><n>```java<n>{Janet, cards} 211<n>Pete, blocks} 50<n>Bob, annoying} 65<n>Boris, frustrating} 60  <n>```<n><n>If you have other questions, please leave a comment below or feel free to reach out to me by clicking my name in the top left corner of this message, as I am more than happy to help!<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:What happens to people playing games? Choices:  A: winning B: entertainment C: happiness D: cheating E: relaxation<n>Output:		Entertainment<n><n>Input: Which best describes the word "recession"?<n>A: A boisterous celebration<n>B: When things are going bad<n>C: When the economy is doing well<n>D: A large amount of money being spent<n>Output: When things are going badly<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>For the multiple choice question we must find out the value of n=9-8=1. Then, since Brenda has 150 cards then Janet must have 149 cards. Similarly, since Mara has twice as much cards as Janet and Mara has 42 cards then in all, the girls have 630 cards.<n>For the mathematical question, we need the total number of blocks in the path of Pete. Since I already have the starting location and the destination location then I can use the distance formula d=r1^(1/2)+r2^(1/2). Then, for my example where r1=5 and r2=20 then I can apply d=(5+(20/2))^(1/2)=50^(1/2)=25.<n><n>My solution to the CAP question is A. I chose B because I thought the answer was a combination of the two words.<n><n>Input:What is the difference between "mathematics" and "mathematicat"?<n>A: Mathematics concerns the study of numbers and their operations. Mathematicat is used to describe women in mathematics.<n><n>C: Not enough characters remaining in the input to display a guess<n><n>Input: The total value of a deck of cards is 120. Choices:  A: earth B: movie C: party D: served cold E: freezer<n>Output:		ice cream is served cold only so it is served without cake also<n><n>### Instruction: Write a Python function that accepts an array, add it to itself twice, then return the result. <n>### Solution:  First Line(s):<n>```python<n>def duplicate(a):<n>```<n><n>### Solution:2 <n>```python<n>def double(a):<n>x=[]<n>x=sum(a)<n>i=sum(a)//2<n>i=i-sum(a//2)<n>n=a-sum(a//i)<n>print(n+x)<n>return(n+x) #Returning value and not using n <n>```<n>### Solution:3<n>```python<n>def dup(a): <n><n>n=sum(a) <n>x=(n/2)*2<n>print(x)<n>return x <n>```<n>## Problem Solution<n>```python<n><n>def duplicate(a)=[1,2,3,4]<n>dup(a)<n><n>```<n>## Output:1,2,3=1+2+3=6<n>```python<n><n>    return (dup(a), dup(a))<n><n>```<n>## The first output is (1,6,4) and second output is (4,6,4)<n>```python<n>```<n><n>import os<n>path = '.\data'<n>files = os.listdir(path)<n><n>for i in files:<n>	if i.split(".")[1] == 'csv':<n>		print("processing "+ i)<n>		f = open(path + i, "rb+")<n>		data = csv.read(f, delimiter=',', encoding='utf-8')<n>		f.close()<n><n>f = open('result.csv', 'w')<n>w = csv.writer(f, dialect='excel')<n>w.writerows(data)<n>f.close()<n>```<n>Output:<n>[('a', 'b', 'c'), ('x', 'y', 'z')]<n><n>## <n>## Instruction:This problem is about using Python dictionaries to hold data, and dictionaries are collections of objects, each with its own unique key.<n><n>## Solution:   <n>```python<n>def myName(i):<n>print("Hello, my name is ", i)
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a coastal, gulf state, where is this person? Choices:  A: alabama B: louisiana C: south carolina D: arkansas E: mountains<n>Output:		A<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>#### Solution :<n><n>## Description<n><n>The first input will be two integer numbers. You have to count the number of cards a player have.<n>Counting the number of cards, your program output should be `211`.<n><n>Explanation:<n><n>We have `Brenda` and `Janet`. There `Janet` has 9 cards more. So `Janet` has `10` cards more than `Brenda`.<n><n>So total cards are `0`, because Brenda have `0`, `1` card as `Janet` have `10`.<n><n>Our output should be `2`. `Mara have twice as many cards as` `Janet`, So she have some extra cards than `Janet` have.<n>So after deducting from `0`, we get `150` and that means Janet have `150` card in all(9 more than Brenda).<n><n>So total cards of them are `150 + 150 = 210`.<n><n>Now `210` is not the right output.<n><n>After that `Janet` deduct again `9` cards because she have `10`. So she have now `91cards.<n><n><n>Next our input would be:<n><n>`Pete walked 5 blocks.`<n><n>Now he have walked `5` blocks from his house to bus garage in Houston(where he took bus). He has `20 blocks` at the bus station to get stamps. So he travelled `25 blocks.<n><n>`Now he came back 25 blocks.`<n><n>So he travelled `50 blocks in all.`<n><n>Finally our input would be: `If one sees a foox and is standing in a costal, gulf state `<n><n>And our choice should be: `A`<n><n>We just asked two input only, But our program works for other inputs also.  <n><n>If our program can get other input than `210` or `50` it should say `I can't solve this.` or `I do not understand`  <n>In the future we should fix this issue.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:The small cabin was not available, so they were upgraded to what? Choices:  A: villa B: spacecraft C: hall D: palace E: hotel<n>Output:		B: spacecraft<n><n>Expected answer for above question is B: spacecraft as it follows the order from first to last. The logic is that: Pete was able to go to the post office from the bus garage in Texas. He did not walk from the house to the bus gararge and neither from the bus garage to the post office, he could only do the last leg of travelling. The other questions are similar to this one where one has to interpret meaning of an instruction.<n><n>### Source code:<n><n>The code for the above questions is [gist](https://gist.github.com/shubh1541/4a684f6c0d49da6222fbda066b264284).

Action<n>Output: E <n><n><n><n>```<n>#include <bits/stdc++.h><n>using namespace std;<n><n><n>int main(){<n>  <n> int a,b,result;<n>  <n>  scanf("%d",&a);// 9<n>  scanf("%*c",&a);<n>  scanf("%1d",&b);// 150<n>  <n>  result = a + b - 9;<n>  printf("%d\n", result );<n>  <n>  <n>  int x,y;<n>  scanf("%ld",x);<n>  scanf(" %ld",y) ;<n>  <n>  <n> int travel_dist= (x + (y * 2) - 50);<n> printf("%d\n\n", trave_dist);<n>}<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:If you're afraid of spiders what should you avoid owning? Choices:  A: meadow B: cupboard C: shed D: mail box E: cellar<n>Output:		A<n><n>### Solution to the third problem<n><n>We start by assuming $91\geq 50$, which is a reasonable assumption. If we let $A=91-x$, then $A\geq 50$.<n>So $9\times A\geq9\times50=450$.<n>Therefore $A >= 80$, and thus $91\geq80+x\geq80+80=160$.<n>Thus the final answer is $160$.<n><n>### Solution for the question on bus travels<n><n>We start by knowing that he walked from A to B, and then rode from B to C. To come up with the total distance walked by Pete, we need to know the distance between the two points. Using the Google maps measurement tool, we have the following:<n><n>A: Texas Roadhouse, Houston, TX<n>B: Memorial Park, Houston, TX (46.3 mi)<n>C: Texas Roadhouse, Pearland, TX (11.1 mi)<n><n>Thus the total distance between his house and the post office is 58 miles.<n><n>### Solution from the quiz question on fear of spiders <n><n>We are given the choice A. Thus, our assumption is that meadow does not cause fear in spiders. From there we can choose any two of the other choices, since a spider won't go to either of those places. Thus<n><n>$C\cap B=\emptyset$<n><n>This means that $B$ is on the diagonal of the grid. Once we know that, the answer is simple:<n><n>$A\cap B=\emptyset=\emptyset\cup B$<n><n>So the answer is definitely A.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:A yard is made up of what? Choices:  A: city B: michigan C: three feet D: subdivision E: three arm span<n>Output:		subdivision<n><n>Input: Mary has 8 books more than her brother. Their sister has 18 books more than Mary. How many books do they have altogether and how many do Mary and her brother have, combined?<n>Output: 39 and 47<n><n>### This is my code<n>```python<n>from collections import Counter<n><n>a = 9<n>b = 2<n><n>jac = a * b # 9, 18, 27<n><n>total = total + jac # 4530<n>print (total)<n><n>jac = b * jac # 36<n><n>kat1 = jac * total # 15920<n>print (total + kat1)<n>total = total + kat1<n><n>card = 40<n>kat = card - 150<n><n>print (32511)<n><n><n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Where would you carry a pen as you go through your day? Choices:  A: pocket B: office supply store C: friend's house D: desk drawer E: city hall<n>Output:		C<n><n># The code is commented for clarity and easy understanding.<n><n>a=`cat input.txt | grep -v '^$'`<n>a=${a#* }<n>a=${a%% *}<n>a=${a// *}<n>a=${#a}<n><n>b=$(cat input_c.txt | grep -A3 -v '^$')<n><n>c=$(echo "$a $b" | awk -F : '{print $2}')<n>x=$(echo "$b" | awk -v a="$a" -F: 'a!=0{x +=2;}{print x}')<n>y=$(echo "$a" | awk -F: '{$1=$1};1')<n>z=$(echo "$b"| head -c2| tail -c2| awk -F: '{sum=0;for(i=1;i<=NF;i++)sum+=$i} END{print sum}')<n>e=$((x+y+(z*c)/a))<n>echo $e<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:The star had 4 rocky planets and 4 gaseous planets orbiting it, what was it part of Choices:  A: hollywood B: night sky C: constellation D: aliens E: solar system<n>Output:		<n><n>### 解法思路:<n><n>- 使用`div mod`实现<n>- 使用条件达到目标数字，输出目标数字<n>- 使用循环，计算所有答案中大于目标数字， <n>- 总数据量<n>- 当每人牌数同时大于差值的时候，判断竑牌数和被牌人数，重复直到第一个相同<n><n><n>```python<n>def get_result(num):<n>    if num ==0:<n>        return 0<n>    elif num % 2 == 0:<n>        return num // 2<n>    else:<n>        return num-1<n><n>def get_answer(num1, num2):<n>    result = 0<n>    while num1 > num2 :<n>        if get_result(result) == num1 :<n>            return result<n>        if num2 > 0 :<n>            num1 = num1 // 2<n>            result = get_answer(num2, result)<n>    return result<n><n>def get_number(num):<n>    <n>    list1 = []<n>    list2 = []<n>    answer = []<n>    number = 1<n>    if int(num) < 20:<n>        for i in range(2,int(num)+1):<n>            list1.append(i)<n>    else:<n><n>        for i in list1:<n>            total = 0<n>            for j in range(10):<n>                total = j + total<n>            print(total)<n>            while i+1 < int(num):<n>                list2.append(i + 1)<n>            <n>            if len(list1) == len(list2):<n>                <n>                result = 0<n>                #print(list1, list2)<n>                if(int(result) < num):<n>                    result =  get_answer(int(list1[-1]),total-int(list1[-2]))<n>                else :<n>                    result = int(list2[0])<n>            answer.append(result)<n>            # print(result)<n>            i = i+1<n>            while

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. The bus fare was $37.50 and the plane fare was $142.50 less than the bus fare. The buses leave every half hour and the flights leave every hour. The buses arrive every 15 minutes, and the plane arrived every 120 minutes. If there were an 8:15 PM bus, at what time did it leave Portland?<n>Output: 9:21 PM<n><n>Explanation: Felipe has been deciding if the plane would be cheaper or not. The plane fare is $120, so 120 - 37.50 = 82.50.<n>The bus leaves every 30 minutes and the plane leaves every hour, so the buses arrive in 45 minutes. The buses arrive at 15 minute intervals, so the bus arrives 45/4 minutes before the plane arrives. The plane arrives every 120, so after 30/3 minutes, the plane has arrived for a total of 123/3 minutes. Felipe arrives every 15 3 minutes, because the plane leaves once every hour, but the bus leaves every half hour, so divide 15 by 2 to get 7.5 minutes. Felipe is at the Portland departure counter at 9:21.<n><n><n>### Input: You've just bought a new car for $16,025. Your interest rate is 11% and you make monthly payments. Choices:  A: strength B: brain C: potential D: qualification E: competence<n>Output:		competence<n>Explanation: The answer is: C which means he got stucked in wheelchair. It means he can only move by wheel chair. This is also an example for disability. Disability doesn't have to be something that doesn't affect the 'brain' or 'qualification'. Disability can have many different types. It can relate to brain, to the 'person' itself and to the 'qualifications' as well. It can be physical or mental.<n><n>10 of 10<n>

Choices:  A: make noise B: band C: museum D: concert hall E: rubber band<n>Output:		band (the most commonly correct answer)<n><n>## Part 1: Input from the user<n><n>> What is the name of the movie?<n>> ```python<n>> Choices1 = ['The matrix', 'Avengers', 'Pirates of the Caribbean', 'Love', 'The Avengers', 'Wonderwoman']<n>> print('What is the name of the Movie?')<n>> choice1=int(input('answer: '))<n>```<n><n>Input:<n>```bash<n>What is the name of your movie?<n>```<n><n>Input options:<n>```bash<n>answer:  1<n>```<n><n>The script should read the response from the user as input.<n><n>## Part 2: Loop using For Iteration<n><n>> How many times the movie was played or how many times played a movie?<n>> ```bash<n>> Choices = [1, 1, 2, 3]<n>> loop1 = 0<n>> while True:<n>>     print('How many times the movie was Played??')<n>>     loop1+=1<n>>     break<n>> print(loop1)<n>```<n><n>Input is the response of the user to the question.<n><n>For each option, if the user selects an option it should be assigned to the variable.<n><n>If the user does not select any option the program should exit.<n><n>If the selected option is between 0 and 3, output the number.<n><n>```bash<n>How many times the movie played?<n>1<n>```<n><n>Input<n>```bash<n>loop0 = 1<n>How many times the Movie played?<n>```<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:How often are secular parties held? Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n>Output:		C<n> <n># Author: Abhiraj Bhaskar<n> <n># Language: Python3<n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>import collections<n>def solve(s):<n>    b = collections.Counter(s.split()),<n>    ans = sum([b[t][1] for t in b.keys()])<n>    return ans<n>```<n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>```python<n>input = "Pete walked 5 blocks\n from his house\n to the bus garage" + "\n in Houston. He rode\n the bus 20\n blocks to the post office\n to get\n some stamps. Later,\n he came\n home the same way. \n \n How many blocks did\n Pete travel in\n all?"<n><n>ans = solve(input)<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n>```python<n>output = '85'<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. Choices:  A: insane B: annoy people around C: enjoy D: inhale E: had good voice<n>Output:		B<n><n><n>You have not been paying attention. There are only 4 ways to solve the above question. You can only get that last question correct if you have been paying attention to all the lessons, and understood what is happening. <n><n>When you get to the next question you will have learned how to solve the previous question. <n><n><n>### Instruction:<n>You will be given 2 sets of numbers.<n>One set of 4 numbers and one set of 2 numbers.<n>Example:<n><n>You will be given the two numbers 2, 4. Answer is 6.<n>You will also be given the following numbers.<n><n>You will be asked if those sets were taken from the following list<n><n>1. 2,3,4,5<n><n><n><n>###Instruction:<n>Here are sets of six numbers.<n><n>5, 4, 3, 2, 1, 10<n><n>You will be provided with two lists of three numbers<n><n>Each list containing only one of those 5 numbers<n><n><n>Example:<n><n>Let us assume the first three numbers are<n><n>5, 7, 9 <n><n>The question would be<n><n>Were these numbers taken from the following sets.<n>Set 1: 5, 7,8<n>Set 2: 8,9,10<n><n>Answer: Set 1, we can say that this set contains the number 5<n><n>Now look at the third set of numbers <n><n>9, 7, 8<n><n>If we exclude number 5, we are left with 7, 8, 9 <n><n>we can state that this set contains these three numbers.<n><n>9, 8, 7<n><n><n><n>## Instruction<n><n>The question will be a list of 4 numbers. This will always be true.<n><n>You will also be presented with two sets of 3 numbers<n><n>Each number in the 3 numbers can only appear once in each group.<n><n>Each group contains only one number of the 4.<n><n><n><n>Example: You are given the following four numbers <n><n>3, 1, 4, 2 <n><n>For the numbers 3,1,4,2<n><n>The answer is 3,4,1<n><n>The only other possibilities are: 1,4,3
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:The mother was worried about all the spills, so she bought a rug for under the what? Choices:  A: persia B: table C: living room D: house E: desk<n>Output:		Table<n><n>Input: Choose an even number between 10 and 15. Subtract 12 from that number then add 3.<n><n>Output: 63<n><n>Input: Add 2 to this number so you get a 3 digit number. Subtract 6 from it. Next multiply it for 3.<n><n>Input: Divide the number in the first set of parentheses by 2, and add it to the number in the second set of parentheses.<n><n>Output: (220 ÷ 2) + (210 ÷ 2 )<n>= 110 + 95<n><n>#!/bin/bash<n>#The script above was entered as /bin/bash instead of bash. In RHEL8 it needs to be bash to run properly.<n><n>#The line $@ is only useful in bash. <n><n># The script above can be called both as:'script.sh' and'script.sh $@'. If it is called'script.sh' only the first argument $1 will be taken as the name of the file that is to be input. If it is called with '$@' only the arguments of the script will be taken as inputs.<n><n>#!/bin/$1<n>while [[ "$1"!= "" ]]<n>do<n>    case "$1" in <n>        '(')<n>        echo "starting case ('"<n>        break<n>        ;;<n>        ')'<n>        echo "ending case ()"<n>        if [[ "$1" == "")<n>        then<n>            echo "done"<n>        else<n>            echo "continue"<n>        fi<n>        case "$1" in<n>        22*<n>        220/2<n>        *2/20<n>        *20/2<n>        200/10<n>        20*<n>        (2x)*2<n>        220-200<n>        *2/100<n>        (2x-100)/2<n>        *20<n>        110-95<n>        *3<n>        (110-98)/3)<n>        echo "$1"<n>        ;;<n>    esac<n>    shift<n>done

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. You should write your code to calculate the output and see if it matches the question. If you have troubles with your code please visit us for the hints.<n>### Hints:<n><n>```python<n>from math import *    <n>def solve_instruction():<n>    with open("/home/ubuntu/test.txt") as f:<n>        for count, line in enumerate(f):<n>            if count == 4:<n>                solution = line.split(" ")<n>                left, right, operation = map(int, solution)<n>                if operation == '+':<n>                    output = left + right<n>                elif operation == '-':<n>                    output -= left <n>                elif operation == '*':<n>                    output *= left<n><n>                if output == right:<n>                    <n><n>                    print(solution)<n>                    <n>            else:<n>                print(line)<n><n>solve_instruction()<n><n>```<n>```python<n><n>def solution(x,y,operation):<n>   if operation == "+":<n>      return x+y<n>   elif operation == "-":<n>      return x-y<n>   elif operation== "*":<n>      return x*y<n>   else:<n>      print("no solution")<n>    <n>solution(110,98,"+")<n>```<n>```python

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:What is done to wood to attach something to it? Choices:  A: nailed B: carved C: polished D: eat cake E: petrify<n>Output:		carved<n><n>Input: A father is 5 times as old as his son. The son is 9 years old. How old is the father?<n>Output: 49<n><n>#### Difficulty Level: Easly<n>#### Time Complexity: O(n)<n>#### Space Complexity: O(1)<n><n>### Solution in Python<n>---<n><n>### My Solution:<n>```python<n>from collections import Counter<n>def solution(cards):<n>    total_cards = sum(cards)<n>    <n>    a,b = total_cards // 151, total_cards %151<n>    <n>    print(b, sep='')<n>    return b<n>    print(a)<n><n># Example Code<n>```<n>---<n><n>## Code Snapshot<n><n>```python<n>from sys import stdin<n>import collections<n><n>cards = collections.Counter(stdin.read())<n><n>print(solution(cards))<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input:In a game of darts, the score shown here could be obtained. What is the score? Choices:<n><n>A: 204<n>B: 56<n>C: 168<n>D: 140<n>Output: D<n><n>Input:The score in a game of bowling could be obtained, assuming that 10 pins are scored for each 11 points bowled. What is the score in this game of bowling? Choices: A: 74 B: 31 C: 144 D: 95 E: 106 Answer: C (there are 11 or 10 pins knocked down)<n><n>#####Instruction:Write the program that will work the following problems using a stack (re-run everyday)<n><n>###Example<n><n>Input:  a: 7, b: 10, c: 6 output: 35<n>Example2:<n>Input:  a : 2, b: 8, c: 0 output: 9<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>import stack<n><n># a: 7,   b: 10 c: 6,  output: 35,    <n><n># a:  2,   b:8,   c:  0, output: 9    <n><n>stack1 = stack.Stack()<n><n>stack2 = stack.Stack()    <n><n>def stacks(a,b,c):<n><n>    stack1 = stack.Stack().push(a).push(b).push(c).pop()<n>    stack2 = stack.Stack().init(stack1)<n>    s1 = stack1.stack<n>    s2 = stack2.stack<n>    a1 = float(s1.pop())<n>    b1 = float(s2.pop())<n>    c1= float(s2.top())<n>    print(a1,b1,c1)<n>def main():<n>    n = input().split()<n>    a, b, c = map(int,n)<n>    print(stacks(a, b,c))<n>                   <n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    data = input()<n>    print("This is a",data)<n>    input(51)<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:What place is not interesting to children? Choices:  A: classroom B: toy store C: school D: soccer game E: dinner<n>Output:		 toy store<n><n>---<n>class Count_The_Blocks<n>{<n>  public:<n>	Count_The_Blocks() { }<n>  int main ( ) //Function that contains the implementation of your Program<n>	{<n>	 //Your code goes here<n>	 //You might want to use cout for debugging purposes<n>	 int n=0<n>	 int j,i,r,c,n1=0<n>	 cin>>i<n>	 while(i<=9)<n>	 {<n>	     cin>>j<n>	     if(j+12==10)//If sum is less than 10, print 11 since 10 will not work as a block<n>		{<n>			// cout<<"The block number is "<<j+1<<"  "<<endl;<n>			n=(n+1);<n>		}<n>	     else if(j+11==10)//if sum is greater then or equal 10, print the sum as a block number since 10 will work.<n>		{<n>           //cout<<"The block number after adding the sum "<<j<<"  is "<<j+9<<" "<<endl;<n>           n=(n+9);<n>		}//end if if the sum is greater or equal than 10, so we can print the sum as a number of blocks in our problem<n>	     else<n>	     {<n>          n=n+j;<n>		  cout<<"The number of block is "<<n<<endl;;<n>	    }//end else since sum will be greater then 10 and 11 and since 11+1=12, 11 will not be a block<n>         i++;<n>	 }//End of the iteration<n>	 cout<<"The total number of blocks is ";<n>    return 0;<n>	}//end of functuions<n>}//end of class Count_The_Block<n><n>---<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:The person is laying on the beach, why would he do that? Choices:  A: sun himself B: thank god C: race against time D: express love E: to think about things.<n>Output:		B<n><n>Input: 2 and 2 are two numbers that are the same size. 5 and 5 are two numbers that are different sizes. 60 and 1 are two numbers that are not the same size. Which two number pairs are the same size? <n>Output: 18 and 110<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>The idea is to count the number of occurrences of the digits 1, 2, 3 and so on, in the given number, which I've done in this solution.<n><n>`a[n] = a[n-1] + " "+str(n)`<n><n>Let's say the number is `n`, we start from the beginning and every time we see the digit `n`, we add another occurrence in the `a` list, where the digit `n` is.<n><n>Note: `a[0]` becomes `a["0"]`<n><n>```py<n>for n in range(1,1001):<n>    a[n] = a[(n-1)] + " "+str(num)<n><n>for n in range():<n>    print(a[n],end = " ")<n><n>print()<n>```<n><n>Output: `1 2 3... 243 244`<n><n>### References<n><n>[1]: https://youtu.be/gD5u7GQVZx0

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Josh ate exactly 2 and 3 / 8ths of the pickle. Kate ate exactly 5 and 5 / 8ths. How much did Kate eat if she is 7 years younger than Josh?<n>Output: 12 1/16<n><n>Input:The number of players for football increases 6% each year. If there were 1200 more players in 2015 than in 2014, how many players were there in 2013?<n>Output: 3409<n><n> Input: How many grams does a 3/4 cup (approximately) weigh?<n> Output:343<n><n> #Program:<n> import ast<n> def sum_all_nodes(A):<n>     n = len(A)<n>     m = []<n>     for i in range(n):<n>         d = ast.parse('')<n>         m = m + [float(n)]<n>         for j in range(i+1,n**2):<n>             d = d.root<n>             v = ast.Variable('v',AST.Int,None).value<n>             n = m[d.right_index-1][1]<n>             n = str(n)<n>             d.root,d.left_index = d.left_index+len(n),d.right_index<n>             if d.value == n:<n>                 #ast.visitor.append_visit_args(visfunc='ast.add_visit', visval=AST.Int, value=v)<n>                 d.value = v<n>                 m = m[:0]+[n]<n>                 #ast.walk(d,AST.visit_infix)<n>                 d = d.right_index-d.left_index+2<n>                 #ast.node_list_from(d)<n>                 break<n>     m.reverse()<n>     m = [int(x) for x in m]<n>     d = ast.parse(str(m))<n>     return m[d.root_index]<n> # Main:<n> def main():<n>      A = ast.parse('''<n>      a<n>      a<n>      b<n>      c = 0<n>      +<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:In the movie a fragile man is causing accidents, his hope is to find a person opposite of him who is what? Choices:  A: undestroyable B: unbreakable C: indestructible D: durable E: invisible<n>Output:		unbreakable<n><n>Input:  An engineer has 8 blue balloons and 3 red balloons. How many balloons does he have. Choices: A: 11 B: 10 C: 7 D: 8 E: none<n>Output: 11<n><n>Input : John has 11 cats, John and Peter each have 11 cats and John and Peter live together how many cats are they left with?<n>Output : 0<n>```<n><n>### Instruction:<n><n>Write a method named sumTwoNumbers that takes two number parameters and returns a sum of those two numbers.<n><n>Example: <n>Input: 3  + 4<n>Output: 7<n>```<n><n>## Solution:<n><n><n>### sumTwoNumbers<n>```swift<n>class Solution {<n>func sumTwoNumbers(_ a: Int, _ b: Int) -> Int {<n>   var result = a + b<n>   if (a >= b) && (a >= 7) {<n>      if (a == 7) {<n>         return result - result / a % 10<n>      }<n>      elseif (a % 2 == 1) {<n>         return a - b<n>      }<n>      if (a % 2 >= a % 4 && a % 2 > 0 && result == 0 && b!= 9 && b!= 10) {<n>         result += a * b<n>         return result<n>      }<n>      result = a - b<n>   }<n>   elseif (a <= b) && (b >= 0) {<n>      if ((a == 7) && (b >= a)) || ((a == b) && (a % 10!= 1)) {<n>         result += 7<n>      }<n>     <n>   }<n>  <n>   return result<n> }<n>}<n>```<n><n><n><n>

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Where can you store you tent and keep it on your person? Choices:  A: sleep in while camping B: camp ground C: woods D: bag E: backpack<n>Output:		B<n><n><h1><n>### 1) What is the sum of the first seven numbers?<n><n>```<n>Input:1 3 5 6 10 12 13<n>Output: 30 <n>```<n><n><h2>Answer:</h2><n>This program is to calculate the sum of all the elements of the array.<n><n>```js<n>const sum = arr => {<n>  let temp = 0;<n>  for(let j = 0; j < arr.length; j++){<n>    temp = temp + arr[j];<n>  }<n>    return temp;<n>}<n>```<n><h1> <n>### 2) Find the total number of appetizing food items?<n><n>```<n>  <n>Input: <n>  1. 316<n>  2. 438<n>  3..140<n>  4. 25.25<n>  5..4<n>  6. .9<n><n>Output: 4047<n><n>```<n><n><n><h2>"Integers"</h2><n>To get the correct answers, we can use "sum" and "summation" in JavaScript.<n>"summation" allows us to add elements of an array, and finally, we need to convert it to a float.<n><n>```<n>const sum = arr1 => {<n>  let summ = arr1[0];<n>  for(let i = 1; i < arr.length; i++){<n>    arr2 += sum;<n>  }<n>    summ = summ + (arr1[i] / 100);<n>  return summ;<n>}<n>``` <n><n><pre><n>Example:<n><n>Input: <n><n>1. 311<n>2. 140<n>3. 25.5<n>4..95<n><n>OutPut: 1946.5<n></pre><n><n><h1><img alt="Happy New Year" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53241272/83746486-f7d8ac80-a878-11ea-95cf-23466f11a1dd.png">

At the end of the game, your answers will be compared to the correct answers. Award to the players whose answers match the correct answers.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the remaining questions without referring to your answer(s) to the previous question.<n><n>Input : Pete is walking 5 blocks from his home to the bus garage at a rate of 0.5 miles per hr on the way to work. He rides the bus at a rate of 20 miles per hr to work and then walks 2 kilometers to his home. How many miles has he walked in all?<n> Output: 3 5/8 miles<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:What is another term for instituting civil action? Choices:  A: confusion B: complications C: riot D: arrest E: protests<n>Output:		C<n><n>Input: Incorrectly inserting the decimal point in this number ______ to get it correct : 6.55555<n>Output: 65<n><n>Input: The population of Chicago in 2008 was 2,615,488 and the population of Houston in 2007 was 2,206,238. About how many people larger is Chicago than Houston?<n>Output: 910K<n><n>Input: What percentage of the population of Germany has green eyes? Choices:  a: 32.2% b: 31.65% c: 31.18% d: 31.25%<n>Output: b<n><n>Input: What is the measure of the central angle formed by the inscribed circle and an equilateral triangle? Choices: a: 60º inch b: 90º inch c: 60˚ centimeter d: 90˚ centimeter e: 60˚ cm<n>Output: a<n><n>Input: If a 4 lb. bag of flour costs $2.25 after a 3% discount, what does the bag cost before the discount?<n>Output: $4.49<n><n>Input: What volume in gallons would be equal to 25 cups of rice?
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Where would I put a rosebush if I did not have any containers to store it in? Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n>Output:		A<n><n><n>## Challenge:<n>The first part of this question asks you to create an if statement that is true if the first condition is true, but false if the second condition is true. The second part of the question is a little more complicated: it asks you to compare two answers and return the one that is greater. This problem is best solved by making sure our conditions and comparisons are in the correct order.<n><n><n>## Solution:<n>In  order to solve the above problem you will need to use the relational operators. You can only use these on logical conditions. In programming the greater operator returns the first result that is greater and is represented by  >. The less than operator < returns the first result that it is less and is represented by <=. Now we have that in essence we need to choose what to execute based on a first condition and a second condition. That is we have if, elif, elif and finally else. You want first the if and then the elif's based on the logic.<n><n>Here is a example:<n>Input: Pete went 10 blocks from his house to a cafe. He went 4 blocks from the cafe to a park. How many blocks did he go in all?<n><n>Output:18<n><n>    if (blocks walked == 10): # first condition<n>        print("You walked 10")<n>        blocks walked = "10"<n>    elif(blocks walked > 10):# second condition greater <n>        print("You  walked 18")<n>        blocks walked == "18"<n>    else:<n>        print("you walked 10") # third condition not true<n>        blocks walked = blocks walked<n>

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Bob needs a level to hang a shelf but cant find one in his home. Where would he go to get one? Choices:  A: glass of water B: build evenly C: garage D: carpenter's shop E: video game<n>Output:		D<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Where do I put my coffee mug after it's dry? Choices:  A: shelf B: desktop C: cabinet D: kitchen E: cupboard<n>Output:		B<n>```<n><n>## Question<n><n>I'll tell you what I don't know.<n><n>### Code<n>```<n>import math<n>def Solution(A,B):<n>    result = False<n>    A.sort()<n>    B.sort()<n>    l = len(A)<n>    m = len(B)<n>    if l!=m:<n>        print "answer is wrong"<n>    elif l!= 0 and m!=0 and A[l-1] == B[m-1]:<n>      if A[l-1]+B[m-1]!= l+1:<n>          if A[l-2] < B[m-2]:<n>              result = A[l-2]+B[m-2]<n>          else:<n>              result = A.pop()+B.pop()<n>      if A[0]<B[0]:<n>        result = A.pop(0)<n>    if result:<n>      print result,<n>    else :<n>      print "Answer is : "<n>```<n><n>### Output of the output<n><n>answer is :  211<n><n>Answer is :  50<n><n>Question :  211 is question.<n><n>Answer is : C :  211

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Mara picked twice as many cards as you did. How many cards do you and your friends have altogether? \nEnter a number: ")<n>    if cards == "Stop":<n>        print("You have passed the tutorial of my class")<n>    if cards < 1: #To stop the user and alert him/her if invalid inputs > 1<n>        print("Please, enter a value greater than 1!")<n>    else: #Validate User input<n>        cards = input.lower()<n>        if  200 < cards < 300:<n>            cards="invalid"<n>        if cards==200:<n>            print("You all have played 200 cards in total!")<n>        else:<n>            cards =cards -40<n>            print("You have played %d cards! Your friend has also played %d cards all in all!" % cards)<n><n>print("Welcome to Dr. Hacker's Tutorials!")<n>cards = input("You picked %d cards more than your friend" % 3)<n>if cards == "Stop": main()<n>else:<n>    main()<n>```<n># My second Solution<n>``` python<n># Tutorial Number 1<n><n># Tutorial Number two<n>```<n>

How many feet of steel does the company need for the machines if they each require 3 feet, 138 feet, 590 feet, and 600 feet of steel?<n>Output: 350.6<n><n>    Explanations:    Sum: 4 types<n>    Type-I: 3.0<n>    Type-II: 6.0<n>    Type -III: 10.0<n>    Type IV: 171.0<n>    Sum of Types is 52.0 feet.<n>    Total: 3.0 + 6.0 + 10.0 + 171.6 = 76.6 feet + 40 feet 126.6 feet<n>    Sum for all is 350.54 feet.  52 ÷ 4 = 13<n>    Divide 350.4 by the size of each to get 126.86.<n>    Round to 126.9 so it is 350<n><n>Input:$s=8,n\in\mathbb{N}$,then\sum\limits_{k=0}^{n-1}(k+1)s^{k}=?$<n>Output:$8,20,12,-4,-1,-1,1,2,3,4$<n>Explanation:<n>Step $1: s^{0}=1$,s$^{1}$=$s (1)$=$s(s(s))=$ (s$^{2}$)$^{1}$<n>Step $2:s^{2}=s (s (s))=$ (s (s (s$^{2}$$)$))=$ 2s (2s

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:The teachers needed to get their classrooms ready for the school year.  What is one thing they might do? Choices:  A: talk too much B: teach children C: open boxes D: answering questions E: giving homework<n>Output:		A <n><n>Input: It is better to have more ________ than to win a tournament<n>Output: money <n><n><n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n>`<n><n><n><n>```python<n>import math        <n>n1 = int(input())<n>n2 = int(input()) <n>n3 = int(input())  <n>n4 = int(input())   <n>ans = n1 + n2<n>print(ans/2) <n>```<n>                  <n>                    The answer is<n><n><n>```python          <n>n1 = 9<n>n2 = 16<n>n3 =5<n>n4 = 5<n><n>answer = n1 + n3 + n2<n>print (answer)<n>```<n>    <n>        The answer is<n>                  <n>                    44<n>                        <n>```python<n>n = 40<n>m = 25<n>ans = n - m<n>print(ans) <n>```<n>    <n>```<n>The answer should be  <n>- 15<n>```<n>    <n>     <n>```python<n>a = math.pow(10, 2) <n>b = 60 <n>c = 5<n>d = 50<n>ans = a*b *c - a*b*d<n>print(ans)<n>```<n>                 The answer is           <n>                          63,615<n>                          <n>```python<n>c = [2,4,6, 8]<n>b = [66, 124,228]<n>l = len(b)<n>n = len(c) <n>print (n * l**2)<n>```<n><n>```<n>The answer is    <n>3,097<n>```<n><n>```python<n>ans = 49 <n>for i in range(1,5): <n>  if not i % ans:<n>    print(i)<n>      <n>from math import sin, cos, acos   <n>pi = math.pi                        <n>print(sin(1*pi/3))    <n>print("The answer is ", (sin(100/3))) <n>print("The answer should be ", (sin(2*pi/3) + 0.2)) <n>print(sin(3*pi/5)) <n>```<n><n>```  <n> The answer should be<n> <n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Wanting to avoid the cabbage spoiling, where did he put it? Choices:  A: grocery store B: refrigerator C: freezer D: plate E: supermarket<n>Output:		grocery store<br><n><n>Input: He decided to take the bus after all. How much would he save by driving instead of taking the bus? Choices: A: $30 B: $40 C: $50 D: $60 E: $70<n>Output: $10<br><n>### Solution code:<n>`#!/usr/bin/python2`<n>```python<n>import sys<n><n>def main():<n>    with open(sys.argv[1]) as fh:<n>        n = fh.read()<n><n>    answer =''.join(n.split()).replace(' ', '') # get rid of the spaces<n>    if answer == '211':<n>        print('yes')<n>    else:<n>        print('no')      <n>    return<n><n>main()<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. Choices:  A: michigan B: stable C: race track D: farm yard E: arizona<n>Output:		stables<n><n>### Code:<n><n>```python<n>#import modules<n>import time<n>import random<n><n>#code<n>guess=input()<n>randomnum=40<n>while guess!= randomnum:<n>    print("too low")<n>    print("Guess again?")<n>    guess=input();<n>    if guess <= randomnum:<n>        print("too high")<n>    else:<n>        print("Correct")<n>        break<n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input:Who designs a building? Choices:  A: builders B: driver C: architect D: fall down E: tradesmen<n>Output:		A<n>input: what is the answer for the following question:Who designs a building Choices:<n>A:builders<n>B:driver<n>C:architect<n>D:fall down<n>E:tradesmen<n>Output: C<n><n>### Instruction: The following is the pseudo-code for determining that answer for Pete’s bus ride.<n><n>### Expected output: 50.<n><n>```<n>bus = 20;<n>blocks = (house - bus) - bus; <n>blocks = blocks + (bus - destination);<n>blocks = blocks - (destination - bus);<n>blocks = Math.abs(blocks);<n>```<n>
